alert.note: Alert for Eastern Windsor; Orange (Vermont) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 18 at 12:53PM EDT by NWS Burlington
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Orange and east central Windsor Counties through 130 PM EDT... At 1252 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Thetford Hill State Park, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... White River Junction, Norwich, Thetford, Thetford Hill State Park, Thetford Center, Fairlee, Hartford, Sharon, Thetford Hill, North Thetford, East Thetford, Union Village, Pompanoosuc, Ely, West Norwich, and Union Village Dam Recreation Area. This includes the following highways... Interstate 89 near mile marker 2. Interstate 91 between mile markers 70 and 95. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
